1, type I | 2, type II | 3, type IIIA | 4, type IIIB | 5, type IV | 6, type V | 7, type VI
Field Note: Rockwood Type I - Sprain of AC ligaments without joint instability. Type II - AC ligament rupture with partial coracoclavicular (CC) ligament sprain, causing mild instability. Type III - Complete AC and CC ligament rupture, leading to clavicular elevation and moderate instability. Type IV - Clavicle displaced posteriorly into the trapezius, due to severe ligamentous disruption. Type V - Severe superior displacement of the clavicle (>100% increase in CC distance), indicating extensive soft tissue injury. Type VI - Inferior displacement of the clavicle under the coracoid, an extremely rare injury due to high-energy trauma.
